com.objetdirect.tatami.client
Class DragAndDropPanel

java.lang.Object
  com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.UIObject
      com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget
          com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Panel
              com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.ComplexPanel
                  com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.AbsolutePanel
                      com.objetdirect.tatami.client.DragAndDropPanel
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.google.gwt.user.client.EventListener, com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.HasWidgets, com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.IndexedPanel, java.lang.Iterable<com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget>
public class DragAndDropPanel
extends com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.AbsolutePanel

Panel allowing the operations of Drag and Drop on the child widgets. This panel positions the widgets with an absolute way(by specifying their position in X, Y). The mechanism of Drag and Drop used here defines two capacities :

  • a widget can be "Draggable". In that case, an user can drag it with the mouse to deposit it on a target target. If the widget is not deposited on a target, it comes back to its previous place.
  • a widget can be target. In that case, it is possible to deposit widgets on them. A target can accept an indeterminate number of draggable widgets.

All combinations are possible. A widget can be:

  • no draggable, no t a target
  • draggable
  • target
  • target and draggable

In every faculty is linked one (at least) or several affordance . For that a draggable widget can be deposited on a target, it has to share at least an affordance with it. An affordance is defined by a String which names it.

It is possible dynamically to add or to remove affordances in one of the faculties of a given widget

  • if at least an affordance is defined for a faculty, the widget acquires faculty
  • if all affordances are removed from a faculty, the widget loses this faculty.
  • a widget which is removed from the panel loses all these faculties (with affordances!)
  • the widgets which are at the same time draggable and target can have a list of affordances for the "draggable" faculty different from the list of affordances for "target" faculty.

The mechanism of Drag and Drop can also be controlled of a programmatic way by recording to the panel some objects in the listening of the event of drop. These objects have to implement interface DragAndDropListener. The treatment of an event of drop is done in two points

  • Objects in listening are solicited a first time to point out if they accept the drop. If at least an object in listening refuses the drop, the registered widget returns to its initial place.
  • If all objects in listening accepted the drop, they are solicited a second time to "execute" the drop. It allows for them to accomplish specific treatments in application, to change position or characteristics of a widget (including the registered widget).

This component uses the library YUI (Yahoo UI). Scripts yahoo.js, dom.js, event.js, dragdraop.js are requiered. It also uses a version altered by the script of example DDPlayer.js. Attention: this script was changed for the good of this component. Do not replace it in with a more recent version of YUI without having brought necessary adjustments.

Some comments on the implemtation:

  • So that a draggable widget can be visible, a base with a "div" for it has to be created (YUI takes the contents of the element DOM to be moved to fabricate the ghost, and not the element DOM itself !). So any addition of a widget within the panel gives rise to hidden creation of a SimplePanel which acts as intermediary (even if the widget is not - still? - draggable)
  • The "draggable" faculty of a widget is always defined "before " target faculty (it is therefore necessary to create DDPlayer always before of DDTarget).
  • YUI does not know how to remove an object of management of Drag and Drop in a selective way: it removes ALL DDProxies systematically (DDTarget or DDPlayer) of a widget when they call dd.unreg. It is therefore necessary to "rebuild " possibly the faculty eradicated in a untimely way.

Author:
Henry

Constructor Detail

DragAndDropPanel

public DragAndDropPanel()
Creates the panel. The initialization of the mechanism of Drag and drop is done if it's necessary

Method Detail

addDraggableWidget

public void addDraggableWidget(com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget widget,
                               int left,
                               int top,
                               java.lang.String affordance)
Adds a widget to the panel. The faculty of being "draggable" is added also to the widget. This doesn't be call for a widget which is already added to the panel.

Parameters:
widget - widget widget to add
left - initial left position of the widget.
top - initial top position of the widget.
affordance - first affordance

setDraggable

public void setDraggable(com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget widget,
                         java.lang.String affordance)
Sets a widget draggable. If the widget was already draggable, this method add a new affordance

Parameters:
widget - widget which becomes draggable or receives a new affordance. This widget has to be added to the panel first
affordance - new affordance

affordance - new affordance

unsetDraggable

public void unsetDraggable(com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget widget,
                           java.lang.String affordance)
Removes an affordance of the draggable faculty of a widget. If this is the last affordance draggable of the widget, this last one lost the draggable faculty.

Parameters:
widget - the widget who loses an affordance. This widget has to be added to the panel first.
affordance - affordance to remove.

Parameters:
widget - the widget who loses an affordance. This widget has to be added to the panel first.
affordance - affordance to remove.

getDraggableAffordances

public java.lang.String[] getDraggableAffordances(com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget widget)
Returns the list of the affordances linked to the faculty draggable of a widget.

Parameters:
widget - widget questioned
Returns:
the list in a array of String linked to the faculty draggable of the widget. If the widget is not draggable, returns null.

getDraggableAffordanceSet

public com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget[] getDraggableAffordanceSet(java.lang.String affordance)
Returns the list of widgets draggable which contains a specific affordance for this faculty.

Parameters:
affordance - affordance to search.
Returns:
the list of the widgets in an array of Widget containing this affordance in their draggable faculty. If no widgets contain this affordance in their draggable faculty, this method returns null.

add

public void add(com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget widget,
                int left,
                int top)
Adds a widget to the panel. If this method is called, the widget is inert : it can't neither be dragged neither be droped (but it will able to get this faculties later). This method create an invisible base will act as intermediary between the panel and the widget.

Overrides:
add in class com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.AbsolutePanel
Parameters:
widget - widget to add in the panel.
left - initial left position of the widget on the panel
top - initial top position of the widget on the panel

remove

public boolean remove(com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget widget)
Removes a widget from the panel. The widget losts automatically all its faculties of Drag and Drop. The base of the widget is destroy.

Specified by:
remove in interface com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.HasWidgets
Overrides:
remove in class com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.AbsolutePanel
Parameters:
widget - widget to remove from the panel

getWidgetLeft

public int getWidgetLeft(com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget widget)
Returns the left position of the widget given in parameter. This method is overriden in order that this position position is asked to the base (which the "super-implmentation" of the panel knows) and not to widget itself (which the "super-implementation" of the panel doesn't know).

Overrides:
getWidgetLeft in class com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.AbsolutePanel
Parameters:
widget - widget to get the position

getWidgetTop

public int getWidgetTop(com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget widget)
Returns the top position of the widget given in parameter. This method is overriden in order that this position position is asked to the base (which the "super-implmentation" of the panel knows) and not to widget itself (which the "super-implementation" of the panel doesn't know).

Overrides:
getWidgetTop in class com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.AbsolutePanel
Parameters:
widget - widget to get the position
